info.headline: Wind Advisory issued August 09 at 3:04PM HST until August 10 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS CONTINUE UNTIL THIS EVENING FOR MOST MOUNTAIN AND LEEWARD AREAS... .Wind speeds will continue to trend lower tonight and tomorrow as the high pressure center north of the islands and Hurricane Dora currently south of the state continue to move westward. However, wind speeds remain elevated enough to warrant keeping the Wind Advisory in effect through tonight. ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...East-northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts around 50 mph. * WHERE...Mainly leeward portions of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Lanai, Kahoolawe, Maui and Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
